1.name: Awareness
1.description: You're becoming aware that trading time for money has limits
capabilities: Understand the difference between income and wealth
1.milestone: Calculate your true hourly rate and identify one skill gap

2.name: Foundation
2.milestone: Create a personal skill development plan

3.name: Skill Builder
3.milestone: Complete one paid project using a new skill

4.name: Value Creator
4.description: Creating value beyond direct time exchange
4.milestone: Generate first income from packaged knowledge/skill

5.name: Leverage Seeker
5.description: Actively building leverage through code, media, or capital
capabilities: Creating content or code that works without you
5.milestone: Create one asset that generates income while you sleep

6.name: System Builder
6.description: Building repeatable systems for wealth creation
6.milestone: Income from systems exceeds 25% of total income

7.name: Equity Thinker
7.description: Thinking in terms of ownership and equity
7.milestone: Own equity in at least one revenue-generating asset

8.name: Wealth Architect
8.description: Designing and building wealth systems at scale
8.milestone: Passive income covers basic living expenses

9.name: Freedom Builder
9.milestone: Can take 6+ months off without income impact

10.name: Wealth Master
10.description: Complete financial freedom with generational wealth potential
10.milestone: Net worth compounds automatically; focus shifts to impact

beginner.title: Calculate Your True Hourly Rate
beginner.instructions: Add up ALL hours you spend on work (commute, prep, recovery, thinking about work). Divide your annual income by total hours. Compare to what you thought your hourly rate was.
beginner.success_criteria: Written calculation showing true hourly rate and reflection on the gap

beginner.title: Identify Your Specific Knowledge
beginner.instructions: List 10 things you know that feel obvious to you but others frequently ask about. These are clues to your specific knowledge.
beginner.success_criteria: List of 10 items with at least 3 that could potentially be monetized

beginner.title: Wealth vs Income Audit
beginner.instructions: List all your income sources. Mark which ones require your time (income) vs which generate money without you (wealth). Calculate the ratio.
beginner.success_criteria: Complete income audit with wealth/income ratio calculated

beginner.title: Quick Property Analysis with the 1% Rule
beginner.instructions: Find 5 rental property listings on Zillow or Redfin. For each, calculate: Monthly Rent / Purchase Price. Mark which ones pass the 1% rule (result >= 0.01). This quick filter eliminates 80% of bad deals.
beginner.success_criteria: 5 properties analyzed with 1% rule calculations, notes on which pass/fail

intermediate.title: Create Your First Digital Asset
intermediate.instructions: Turn one piece of your specific knowledge into a digital asset: a template, checklist, mini-guide, or video. Something that can help others without requiring your live presence.
intermediate.success_criteria: One completed digital asset ready to share or sell

intermediate.title: Build a Value Equation Offer
intermediate.instructions: Using Hormozi's Value Equation, design an offer for your skill. Calculate Dream Outcome, Perceived Likelihood, Time Delay, and Effort/Sacrifice for your client.
intermediate.success_criteria: Written offer with all four value equation components optimized

intermediate.title: Network Up Challenge
intermediate.instructions: Identify 5 people who earn 10x what you earn. Research how you could provide value to them. Reach out to at least 2 with a value-first message.
intermediate.success_criteria: 2 personalized outreach messages sent to high-value connections

intermediate.title: Full Rental Property Deal Analysis
intermediate.instructions: Pick one rental property that passed the 1% rule. Do a complete analysis: calculate all expenses (mortgage, taxes, insurance, maintenance 10%, vacancy 5%, property management 10%, CapEx), subtract from gross rent to get net cash flow. Calculate Cash-on-Cash return (annual cash flow / total cash invested).
intermediate.success_criteria: Complete deal analysis worksheet with all numbers, cash flow projection, and go/no-go decision

advanced.title: Design Your Leverage Stack
advanced.instructions: Map out how you'll combine the four types of leverage: Labor, Capital, Code, Media. Create a 12-month plan to build at least 2 leverage types.
advanced.success_criteria: Written 12-month leverage building plan with specific milestones

advanced.title: Grand Slam Offer Workshop
advanced.instructions: Build a complete Grand Slam Offer: Define your target market, list all their problems, create solutions for each, add bonuses that reduce risk, set pricing that feels like a steal.
advanced.success_criteria: Complete Grand Slam Offer document ready to test with prospects

advanced.title: Passive Income Machine Blueprint
advanced.instructions: Design a system that could generate $1000/month passively within 12 months. Map every component: product, traffic, conversion, delivery, support.
advanced.success_criteria: Complete blueprint with realistic timeline and required resources

advanced.title: House Hack Business Plan
advanced.instructions: Create a complete house hacking plan: Research FHA loan requirements (3.5% down), find 3 multi-family properties (2-4 units) in your area, analyze each fully (purchase price, down payment, mortgage, rental income from other units, your net housing cost), compare to your current rent, calculate first-year wealth building (equity, appreciation, tax benefits).
advanced.success_criteria: Complete house hack business plan with 3 property options analyzed, financing plan, and timeline to execute

cross_module_connections.insight: Sales skills are the fastest path to increased income - you can double your rates with better positioning and negotiation
cross_module_connections.combined_exercise: Practice pitching your specific knowledge in a 60-second value statement. Test it on 5 people this week.

cross_module_connections.insight: Deep work compounds wealth - one focused hour can produce more value than 8 distracted hours
cross_module_connections.combined_exercise: Block 2 hours for your highest-value skill development. Track what you produce vs unfocused time.

cross_module_connections.insight: Your beliefs about money determine your ceiling - most wealth limits are self-imposed
cross_module_connections.combined_exercise: Write down 5 beliefs you hold about wealth. Challenge each one: is this a fact or a limiting belief?

cross_module_connections.insight: Wealth at scale requires business thinking - individual income has natural limits
cross_module_connections.combined_exercise: Take your best skill and design a business model around it that doesn't require your time for every dollar

masters.name: Naval Ravikant
key_principles: Seek wealth, not money or status. Wealth is having assets that earn while you sleep.
You're not going to get rich renting out your time. You must own equity.
Arm yourself with specific knowledge, accountability, and leverage.
Code and media are permissionless leverage. They're the leverage of the new rich.
Play long-term games with long-term people.
Pick an industry where you can play long-term games with long-term people.
The Internet has massively broadened the possible space of careers. Most people haven't figured this out yet.
daily_practices: Spend 1 hour learning something that compounds
Build something that can work without you
Invest in relationships with high-integrity people

worked_examples.title: Building Leverage Through Content
worked_examples.scenario: You're a software developer earning $150k trading time for money. You want to break free from the time-for-money trap.
worked_examples.framework_applied: Specific knowledge + Media leverage + Code leverage
step_by_step: Identify your specific knowledge: You've debugged hundreds of production systems and developed intuitions others lack
Start creating content: Write Twitter threads about debugging war stories (media leverage - costs nothing to replicate)
Build tools: Create open-source debugging utilities that showcase your expertise (code leverage)
Attract opportunities: Companies start reaching out for consulting at 3x your hourly rate
Productize: Turn your debugging framework into a course/product that sells while you sleep
Scale: The content keeps working, the tools keep attracting users, the course keeps selling
worked_examples.outcome: Within 2 years: consulting income at 3x previous rate, plus $5k/month from products, working fewer hours

worked_examples.title: Compounding Through Specific Knowledge
worked_examples.scenario: You notice you're always the one people ask about a specific topic at work, but you never thought to monetize it.
worked_examples.framework_applied: Specific knowledge identification + Accountability + Long-term games
step_by_step: Recognize the signal: When colleagues constantly ask you about X, that's your specific knowledge
Take accountability: Put your name on it publicly - start a newsletter, podcast, or blog about X
Play long-term: Don't expect immediate returns, compound your reputation over 2-3 years
Document everything: Turn your knowledge into reusable assets (templates, frameworks, processes)
Let opportunities find you: As your reputation grows, high-value opportunities appear
worked_examples.outcome: Your specific knowledge becomes your moat - others can't compete because they don't have your unique combination of skills and experience

scripts_templates.title: Specific Knowledge Discovery Script
scripts_templates.context: Use to identify your unique differentiator that can become the foundation for wealth creation
scripts_templates.template:
1. What do I know that feels obvious to me but confuses others? ___
2. What do people consistently ask me for help with? ___
3. What could I talk about for 30 minutes without preparation? ___
4. What skills did I develop through unique life experiences? ___
5. Where do my interests and abilities intersect with market needs? ___
scripts_templates.example_filled:
1. How to debug production systems under pressure - it's intuitive to me now
2. Code architecture decisions, system design, incident response
3. Distributed systems failure modes and recovery patterns
4. Learned resilience from years of on-call rotations at fast-growing startups
5. Companies desperately need people who can fix systems fast - I can teach this

scripts_templates.title: Leverage Audit Template
scripts_templates.context: Evaluate your current leverage situation and identify opportunities
scripts_templates.template:
LABOR LEVERAGE:
- Do I have a team? ___
- Am I building others' skills? ___

CAPITAL LEVERAGE:
- Do I have money working for me? ___
- Am I reinvesting in growth? ___

CODE LEVERAGE:
- Have I built software/tools? ___
- Can I automate my expertise? ___

MEDIA LEVERAGE:
- Am I creating content? ___
- Does my content work while I sleep? ___

BIGGEST OPPORTUNITY: ___
scripts_templates.example_filled:
LABOR: No team yet, but could hire VA for $500/month to 10x output
CAPITAL: Investing 20% of income, could increase to 30%
CODE: Built internal tools - could open source or productize
MEDIA: Zero content creation - BIGGEST GAP
BIGGEST OPPORTUNITY: Start creating content around my debugging expertise

books.title: The Almanack of Naval Ravikant
books.author: Eric Jorgenson
books.key_takeaway: Wealth is assets that earn while you sleep - focus on equity, not income

books.title: How to Get Rich (without getting lucky)
books.author: Naval Ravikant (Tweetstorm)
books.key_takeaway: The complete framework for modern wealth creation through leverage and specific knowledge

podcasts.title: Naval on The Knowledge Project
podcasts.key_takeaway: Deep dive on specific knowledge and playing long-term games

podcasts.title: Naval on Joe Rogan
podcasts.key_takeaway: Accessible introduction to Naval's wealth and happiness philosophy

masters.name: Alex Hormozi
key_principles: The goal is to make your offer so good people feel stupid saying no.
Volume negates luck. Do more.
Skills are the only assets that can't be taken from you.
The fastest way to get rich is to solve a painful problem for people who can pay.
Price is what you pay, value is what you get. Increase the gap.
Most businesses fail because of obscurity, not because the product sucks.
Discipline is choosing between what you want now and what you want most.
daily_practices: Do 100 outreach touches
Improve your offer daily
Stack skills that multiply each other

worked_examples.title: Building a Grand Slam Offer
worked_examples.scenario: You're a fitness coach charging $100/month and struggling to get clients. You need to transform your offer.
worked_examples.framework_applied: Value Equation: (Dream Outcome × Perceived Likelihood) / (Time Delay × Effort & Sacrifice)
step_by_step: Define the Dream Outcome: Not 'fitness coaching' but 'Lose 30 lbs in 90 days and keep it off forever'
Increase Perceived Likelihood: Add guarantee - 'Lose 30 lbs or I'll coach you free until you do'
Decrease Time Delay: 'See changes in your first week or money back'
Decrease Effort: 'I'll create your meal plan, shopping lists, and tell you exactly what to eat each day'
Add bonuses that address objections: Recipe book, accountability check-ins, private community
Name it powerfully: 'The 90-Day Total Body Transformation System'
Price based on value, not time: If client values losing 30 lbs at $10k, price at $2k feels like a steal
worked_examples.outcome: Price increases from $100/month to $2000 for 90 days, close rate actually increases because offer is irresistible

worked_examples.title: Volume Negates Luck in Action
worked_examples.scenario: You're trying to grow your consulting business but only doing 2-3 outreach messages per day.
step_by_step: Diagnose: At 3 outreach/day with 1% response rate = 0.03 conversations/day = ~1/month
10X the volume: 30 outreach/day = 300/month = 3 conversations/month
Further 10X: 100 outreach/day = 3000/month = 30 conversations/month
Improve quality while scaling: Test different messages, track what works
Compound: Better targeting + better message + more volume = exponential results
Systematize: Create templates, hire help, automate where possible
worked_examples.outcome: Going from 3 to 100 daily touches increases pipeline by 33x. Even with lower conversion, results compound dramatically.

scripts_templates.title: Value Equation Calculator
scripts_templates.context: Use to design offers that feel like a steal at any price point
scripts_templates.template:
DREAM OUTCOME (What do they really want?):
___

PERCEIVED LIKELIHOOD (Why will they believe it's possible?):
- Social proof: ___
- Guarantee: ___
- Credentials: ___

TIME DELAY (How fast will they see results?):
- First win: ___
- Full transformation: ___

EFFORT & SACRIFICE (What do you do FOR them?):
- Done-for-you elements: ___
- Reduced friction: ___

FINAL OFFER NAME: ___
PRICE POINT: ___
scripts_templates.example_filled:
DREAM OUTCOME: Land a $150k+ software job without a CS degree

PERCEIVED LIKELIHOOD:
- Social proof: 47 students hired at FAANG in last 6 months
- Guarantee: Get hired or get your money back + I'll coach you free for 6 more months
- Credentials: Former Google interviewer, hired 100+ engineers

TIME DELAY:
- First win: Mock interview confidence in week 1
- Full transformation: Job offer within 90 days

EFFORT & SACRIFICE:
- Done-for-you: Custom study plan, resume rewrite, LinkedIn optimization
- Reduced friction: Daily 15-min modules, not 4-hour lectures

FINAL OFFER NAME: The $150K Engineer Accelerator
PRICE POINT: $3,000 (2% of first year salary increase)

scripts_templates.title: 100 Touches Daily System
scripts_templates.context: Framework for hitting massive outreach volume consistently
scripts_templates.template:
MORNING BLOCK (50 touches):
- Platform 1: ___ touches of type ___
- Platform 2: ___ touches of type ___

AFTERNOON BLOCK (30 touches):
- Follow-ups: ___
- Warm outreach: ___

EVENING BLOCK (20 touches):
- Engagement: ___
- Community: ___

TRACKING:
- Total sent: ___
- Responses: ___
- Conversations: ___
- Conversion rate: ___
scripts_templates.example_filled:
MORNING BLOCK (50 touches):
- LinkedIn: 30 connection requests + personalized notes
- Email: 20 cold emails to target list

AFTERNOON BLOCK (30 touches):
- Follow-ups: 15 day-3 follow-ups, 10 day-7 follow-ups
- Warm outreach: 5 referral requests from happy clients

EVENING BLOCK (20 touches):
- Engagement: 10 thoughtful comments on prospect posts
- Community: 10 value-add comments in industry groups

TRACKING: Spreadsheet updated daily, weekly review every Sunday

books.title: $100M Offers

books.key_takeaway: How to create offers so good people feel stupid saying no

books.title: $100M Leads
books.author: Alex Hormozi
books.key_takeaway: How to get strangers to want to buy your stuff

podcasts.title: The Game Podcast
podcasts.key_takeaway: Weekly tactical business advice from Hormozi's experience scaling businesses

masters.name: Warren Buffett
key_principles: The most important investment you can make is in yourself.
Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.
It's better to hang out with people better than you.
The difference between successful people and really successful people is that really successful people say no to almost everything.
Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.
daily_practices: Read 500 pages a day
Think in decades, not days
Say no to protect your time for what matters

worked_examples.title: Compounding Knowledge Over Decades
worked_examples.scenario: You're early in your career and wondering whether to spend time learning or earning more now.
worked_examples.framework_applied: Invest in yourself + Compound interest on knowledge
step_by_step: Recognize: Knowledge compounds like money - each new piece connects to existing pieces
Commit to reading: Even 1 hour/day = 365 hours/year = 30+ books = top 1% of learners
Be patient: The first year feels slow, by year 5 you're making connections others can't see
Choose wisely: Focus on timeless knowledge (psychology, economics, history) over trends
Apply immediately: Read something, apply it that day, compound the learning
Build a latticework: Connect knowledge across disciplines like Munger's mental models
worked_examples.outcome: After 10 years of consistent learning, your decision-making quality is dramatically higher than peers who stopped learning after school

scripts_templates.title: Investment in Self Audit
scripts_templates.context: Evaluate whether you're prioritizing the highest-ROI investment: yourself
scripts_templates.template:
SKILL INVESTMENTS THIS MONTH:
- Hours spent learning: ___
- Books/courses completed: ___
- Skills actively developing: ___

RELATIONSHIP INVESTMENTS:
- Time with people better than me: ___
- Mentors/advisors consulted: ___
- Valuable connections made: ___

HEALTH INVESTMENTS:
- Protecting my ability to compound: ___

BIGGEST GAP: ___
NEXT ACTION: ___
scripts_templates.example_filled:
SKILL INVESTMENTS: 20 hours learning, 2 books, developing sales skills
RELATIONSHIP INVESTMENTS: 4 hours with mentor, joined mastermind group
HEALTH INVESTMENTS: Consistent sleep, daily exercise
BIGGEST GAP: Not enough time with people 10x ahead of me
NEXT ACTION: Attend industry conference next month

books.title: The Essays of Warren Buffett
books.author: Warren Buffett
books.key_takeaway: Timeless principles on value, patience, and long-term thinking

books.title: The Snowball
books.author: Alice Schroeder
books.key_takeaway: How Buffett built his wealth through decades of compounding

podcasts.title: Berkshire Hathaway Annual Meeting
podcasts.key_takeaway: Direct wisdom from Buffett and Munger on business and life

masters.name: Charlie Munger
key_principles: Spend each day trying to be a little wiser than you were when you woke up.
The best thing a human can do is to help another human know more.
Invert, always invert. Turn a situation or problem upside down.
You don't have to be brilliant, only a little bit wiser than the other guys, on average, for a long time.
Knowing what you don't know is more useful than being brilliant.
Take a simple idea and take it seriously.
daily_practices: Read across disciplines
Invert problems to find solutions
Avoid stupidity rather than seeking brilliance

worked_examples.title: Inversion in Career Decisions
worked_examples.scenario: You're trying to figure out how to succeed in your career.
worked_examples.framework_applied: Inversion - instead of asking how to succeed, ask how to fail
step_by_step: Invert the question: Instead of 'How do I succeed?' ask 'How would I guarantee failure?'
List failure paths: Be unreliable, stop learning, burn bridges, avoid hard conversations, blame others
Invert each one: Be relentlessly reliable, never stop learning, build relationships carefully, have hard conversations early, take ownership
Focus on avoiding failure: Often easier than achieving brilliance
Apply daily: Each morning, ask 'What would make today a disaster?' and avoid those things
worked_examples.outcome: By systematically avoiding ways to fail, you end up in the top percentile almost automatically

scripts_templates.title: Inversion Problem-Solving Template
scripts_templates.context: Use when stuck on a problem or decision
scripts_templates.template:
GOAL: ___

INVERTED QUESTION: How would I guarantee the opposite?

FAILURE PATHS:
1. ___
2. ___
3. ___
4. ___
5. ___

INVERTED SOLUTIONS (avoid these failures):
1. ___
2. ___
3. ___
4. ___
5. ___

SIMPLE RULE TO FOLLOW: ___
scripts_templates.example_filled:
GOAL: Build a successful consulting business

INVERTED QUESTION: How would I guarantee my consulting business fails?

FAILURE PATHS:
1. Overpromise and underdeliver
2. Take on any client with a pulse
3. Never ask for referrals
4. Compete on price
5. Stop learning and become obsolete

INVERTED SOLUTIONS:
1. Underpromise, overdeliver every time
2. Only work with ideal clients who value expertise
3. Systematically ask every happy client for referrals
4. Compete on value and specialization
5. Dedicate 20% of time to learning and R&D

SIMPLE RULE: Do the opposite of what would make me fail

books.key_takeaway: Organized compilation of Munger's thinking frameworks

podcasts.key_takeaway: Annual Q&A where Munger shares unfiltered wisdom

masters.name: MrBeast (Jimmy Donaldson)
key_principles: Reinvest everything back into getting better.
Study your craft obsessively. Watch 1000 videos, analyze what works.
The first 100 videos will suck. Make them anyway.
Optimize for the long term. Short-term thinking kills businesses.
Surround yourself with people who are obsessed like you.
Every video should be better than the last.
daily_practices: Study your industry obsessively
Reinvest in your skills and assets
Get 1% better every single day

worked_examples.title: Obsessive Improvement in Your Craft
worked_examples.scenario: You want to build media leverage but don't know where to start.
step_by_step: Study obsessively: Watch/read 100 pieces of content in your niche, analyze what works
Start creating: Accept the first 50-100 will be bad - that's the cost of admission
Reinvest everything: Put revenue back into better equipment, skills, team
Find obsessed peers: Join or create a group of people as committed as you
Optimize for learning: Each piece of content is an experiment, track what works
Play long-term: Think in years, not weeks - compound improvement over time
worked_examples.outcome: After 2-3 years of consistent improvement, you'll be in the top 1% of your niche simply because most people quit

scripts_templates.title: Content Reinvestment Calculator
scripts_templates.context: Plan how to reinvest revenue back into growth
scripts_templates.template:
CURRENT REVENUE: $___/month

REINVESTMENT ALLOCATION:
- Equipment/Tools (___%)): $___
- Skills/Education (___%)): $___
- Team/Delegation (___%)): $___

COMPOUND EFFECT:

scripts_templates.example_filled:

REINVESTMENT ALLOCATION:

- Team/Delegation (30%): $1,500 - editor, VA

COMPOUND EFFECT:
Reinvesting 85% for 12 months = 10x improvement in quality and reach

books.title: MrBeast's Creator Philosophy
books.author: Various Interviews
books.key_takeaway: Obsessive improvement and long-term thinking beat talent

podcasts.title: MrBeast on Colin and Samir
podcasts.key_takeaway: Deep dive into content strategy and business building

podcasts.title: MrBeast on Lex Fridman
podcasts.key_takeaway: Philosophy behind becoming the biggest YouTuber

masters.name: Brandon Turner
masters.expertise: Real estate investing, BiggerPockets methodology, rental properties
key_principles: House hacking: Live in one unit, rent the others. Your tenant pays your mortgage.
The 1% rule: Monthly rent should be at least 1% of purchase price for good cash flow.
BRRRR method: Buy, Rehab, Rent, Refinance, Repeat - infinite returns possible.
Real estate creates wealth through four ways: cash flow, appreciation, tax benefits, and loan paydown.
Start small, learn cheap. Your first deal doesn't have to be perfect.
Location, location, location is wrong. Cash flow, cash flow, cash flow is right.
daily_practices: Analyze one property deal daily - build your evaluation muscle
Network with real estate investors regularly
Study market trends in your target areas

worked_examples.title: House Hacking for Near-Zero Living Costs
worked_examples.scenario: You're paying $2000/month in rent and it feels like throwing money away. You want to build wealth but have limited capital.
step_by_step: BUY: Purchase a duplex/triplex/fourplex with FHA loan (3.5% down, must live there 1 year)
EXAMPLE: $300K fourplex, $10,500 down payment, $2,100/month mortgage
RENT: Rent 3 units at $800 each = $2,400/month income
RESULT: $2,400 income - $2,100 mortgage = $300/month positive cash flow
BONUS: You live for free (or get paid $300 to live there)
WEALTH BUILD: Tenants pay down your mortgage, you gain equity and appreciation
AFTER 1 YEAR: Move out, rent all 4 units, repeat with next property
worked_examples.outcome: In one year: Near-zero housing costs, building equity, learning landlording, positioned to scale. This is how you build a real estate empire from nothing.

worked_examples.title: BRRRR Method for Infinite Returns
worked_examples.scenario: You have $50K and want to maximize your real estate investing impact.
worked_examples.framework_applied: BRRRR - Buy, Rehab, Rent, Refinance, Repeat
step_by_step: BUY: Find distressed property for $100K (worth $150K fixed up)
REHAB: Invest $25K in renovations, now worth $150K
RENT: Get tenants in place, generates $1,200/month
REFINANCE: Bank appraises at $150K, lends 75% = $112,500
RECOVER: Get back your $100K purchase + $25K rehab = $125K, keep $12,500 difference
REPEAT: Use that $125K to do it again, while first property cash flows
SCALE: Do this 3-4 times with same $50K, now own $600K+ in real estate
worked_examples.outcome: You've turned $50K into a portfolio generating monthly cash flow, with most or all of your capital recovered to deploy again.

scripts_templates.title: Property Analysis Worksheet
scripts_templates.context: Quickly evaluate if a rental property is a good investment
scripts_templates.template:
PROPERTY ADDRESS: ___

PURCHASE ANALYSIS:
Purchase price: $___
Down payment (____%): $___
Closing costs: $___
Rehab budget: $___
TOTAL CASH IN: $___

INCOME:
Monthly rent: $___
Other income: $___
GROSS MONTHLY INCOME: $___

EXPENSES:
Mortgage (P&I): $___
Property tax: $___
Insurance: $___
HOA/Condo fees: $___
Maintenance (10%): $___
Vacancy (5-10%): $___
Property mgmt (10%): $___
CapEx reserve: $___
TOTAL MONTHLY EXPENSES: $___

CASH FLOW:
Gross income - Total expenses = $___

RETURN METRICS:
Cash-on-Cash Return: (Annual cash flow / Total cash in) = ___%
1% Rule: Monthly rent / Purchase price = ___% (want >1%)
50% Rule: Expenses ≈ 50% of gross rent? ___

DECISION: [ ] Buy [ ] Pass [ ] Negotiate
scripts_templates.example_filled:
PROPERTY: 123 Main St, 3-unit

PURCHASE:
Price: $250,000
Down (25%): $62,500
Closing: $5,000
Rehab: $15,000
TOTAL CASH: $82,500

INCOME:
Rent (3 units × $900): $2,700
Other: $0
GROSS: $2,700

EXPENSES:
Mortgage: $1,050
Tax: $250
Insurance: $100
HOA: $0
Maintenance: $270
Vacancy (5%): $135
Prop Mgmt: $270
CapEx: $150
TOTAL: $2,225

CASH FLOW: $2,700 - $2,225 = $475/month = $5,700/year

RETURNS:
Cash-on-Cash: $5,700 / $82,500 = 6.9% (decent)
1% Rule: $2,700 / $250,000 = 1.08% (PASS)
50% Rule: $2,225 / $2,700 = 82% expenses (high but manageable with prop mgmt)

DECISION: [x] Buy - good cash flow, meets 1% rule

scripts_templates.title: House Hacking Calculator
scripts_templates.context: Determine if house hacking makes sense vs renting
scripts_templates.template:
CURRENT SITUATION:
Rent you pay now: $___/month
Annual rent: $___

HOUSE HACK OPTION:
Property price: $___
Down payment (3.5% FHA): $___
Monthly mortgage (P&I + tax + ins): $___
Number of rentable units: ___
Rent per unit: $___
Total rental income: $___

YOUR HOUSING COST:
Mortgage: $___
Minus rental income: -$___
NET COST: $___

COMPARISON:
Current rent: $___/month
House hack cost: $___/month
MONTHLY SAVINGS: $___
ANNUAL SAVINGS: $___

WEALTH BUILDING:
Equity gained (Year 1): $___
Appreciation (3%): $___
Tax benefits: $___

DECISION: Is house hacking worth it? ___
scripts_templates.example_filled:
CURRENT:
Rent: $1,800/month
Annual: $21,600

HOUSE HACK:
Price: $350,000 (fourplex)
Down (3.5%): $12,250
Mortgage: $2,450/month
Units to rent: 3
Rent per unit: $1,000
Total income: $3,000

MY COST:
Mortgage: $2,450
Rental income: -$3,000
NET: -$550 (I get paid $550 to live there!)

COMPARISON:
Current rent: $1,800
House hack: -$550
SAVINGS: $2,350/month = $28,200/year

WEALTH:
Equity: ~$8,000 (loan paydown)
Appreciation: $10,500 (3%)
Tax benefits: ~$5,000
TOTAL YEAR 1 BENEFIT: ~$52,000

DECISION: Absolutely worth it. Live free AND build wealth.

masters.name: Nic Carter
masters.expertise: Bitcoin, crypto fundamentals, monetary theory, digital assets
key_principles: Bitcoin is digital scarcity - the first time in history we can prove ownership of digital assets.
Not your keys, not your coins. Self-custody is fundamental to crypto ownership.
Bitcoin is a hedge against monetary debasement and currency devaluation.
Most altcoins are securities or outright scams. Bitcoin is the only truly decentralized crypto.
Crypto is about separating money from state - it's a political statement, not just technology.
Time preference: Bitcoin teaches you to think long-term, not trade for quick gains.
daily_practices: Dollar-cost average into Bitcoin consistently
Learn about self-custody and security best practices
Study monetary history and why Bitcoin matters

worked_examples.title: Bitcoin as Savings Technology
worked_examples.scenario: You have savings in a bank account earning 0.5% while inflation is 7%. You're losing purchasing power.
worked_examples.framework_applied: Bitcoin as Inflation Hedge + Time Preference
step_by_step: UNDERSTAND: Fiat currency loses value over time due to unlimited printing
RECOGNIZE: Bitcoin has a hard cap of 21 million coins - provably scarce
STRATEGY: Allocate 5-10% of savings to Bitcoin as long-term store of value
APPROACH: Dollar-cost average (DCA) - buy fixed amount weekly/monthly regardless of price
EXAMPLE: $100/week into Bitcoin, regardless if it's $30K or $60K
HOLD: Think in 5-10 year timeframes, not days or weeks
CUSTODY: Learn self-custody (hardware wallet) - 'not your keys, not your coins'
TAX: Understand that selling triggers capital gains - holding long-term preferred
worked_examples.outcome: Over 10+ years, Bitcoin has outperformed all assets. You've protected purchasing power and potentially grown wealth significantly.

worked_examples.title: Self-Custody Best Practices
worked_examples.scenario: You bought Bitcoin on Coinbase but heard 'not your keys, not your coins.' You want to control your assets.
step_by_step: LEARN: When Bitcoin is on an exchange, you don't own it - the exchange does
HARDWARE WALLET: Buy a Ledger or Trezor (cost: $50-200)
SETUP: Initialize wallet, write down seed phrase (12-24 words)
SECURE SEED: Store seed phrase offline (metal backup, multiple secure locations)
TRANSFER: Move Bitcoin from exchange to your hardware wallet
VERIFY: Confirm you control the private keys by testing a small transaction
NEVER: Share seed phrase with anyone, type it on a computer, take a photo of it
MULTISIG (advanced): Use multisig wallets requiring 2-of-3 or 3-of-5 keys for extra security
worked_examples.outcome: You now truly own your Bitcoin. No exchange can freeze, confiscate, or lose your funds. You're your own bank.

scripts_templates.title: Bitcoin Allocation Framework
scripts_templates.context: Determine appropriate Bitcoin allocation in your portfolio
scripts_templates.template:
PORTFOLIO CONTEXT:
Total investable assets: $___
Risk tolerance: [ ] Conservative [ ] Moderate [ ] Aggressive
Time horizon: ___ years
Current Bitcoin exposure: ___%

ALLOCATION GUIDELINES:
- Conservative (10+ year horizon): 2-5%
- Moderate (10+ year horizon): 5-10%
- Aggressive (can stomach 80% drawdowns): 10-20%+

MY TARGET ALLOCATION: ___%
Dollar amount: $___

DCA STRATEGY:
Monthly investment: $___
Purchase frequency: [ ] Weekly [ ] Bi-weekly [ ] Monthly
Platform: ___
Automatic? [ ] Yes [ ] No

EXIT STRATEGY:
When/if I'll sell: ___
Target price (if any): $___
Or holding indefinitely? [ ]

SECURITY:
Custody plan: [ ] Exchange [ ] Hardware wallet [ ] Multisig
Seed phrase backup locations: ___
scripts_templates.example_filled:
PORTFOLIO:
Total assets: $200,000
Risk: [x] Moderate
Horizon: 15 years (retirement)
Current BTC: 2%

TARGET: 8% ($16,000)

DCA:
Monthly: $500
Frequency: [x] Weekly ($125/week)
Platform: Swan Bitcoin (auto DCA)
Automatic: [x] Yes

EXIT:
No plan to sell before retirement (15 years)
Target: None, evaluating in 2035
Holding: [x] Indefinitely unless emergency

SECURITY:
Custody: [x] Hardware wallet (Trezor)
Seed: Metal backup in home safe + bank safety deposit box
Once over $50K in BTC: Consider multisig

scripts_templates.title: Crypto vs Bitcoin Decision Tree
scripts_templates.context: Should you buy altcoins or stick with Bitcoin?
scripts_templates.template:
INVESTMENT THESIS QUESTIONS:

1. Do you understand the technology deeply? [ ]
2. Is it truly decentralized (no company/foundation controls it)? [ ]
3. Has it been around 5+ years without major hacks? [ ]
4. Is there a real use case beyond speculation? [ ]
5. Can you explain why it's better than Bitcoin? [ ]
6. Would regulators classify it as a security? [ ]
7. Are you investing or speculating? [ ]

IF MOSTLY NO: Stick with Bitcoin
IF MOSTLY YES: Maybe allocate small % to that specific altcoin

RED FLAGS:
- Promises of guaranteed returns
- Anonymous team
- Lacks audit trail
- Pre-mine or founder holdings >20%
- Marketing > technology

BITCOIN ADVANTAGES:
- Most decentralized
- Longest track record
- Most secure network
- Regulatory clarity
- Digital gold narrative
scripts_templates.example_filled:
Evaluating Ethereum:

1. Understand tech? [~] Somewhat
2. Decentralized? [~] Less than Bitcoin (foundation, Vitalik influence)
3. 5+ years, no hacks? [x] Yes (launched 2015)
4. Real use case? [x] Smart contracts, DeFi
5. Better than Bitcoin? [ ] Different purpose, not better
6. Security classification? [?] Unclear, possible
7. Investing or speculating? [~] Bit of both

DECISION: Ethereum has real utility but higher risk than Bitcoin
APPROACH: 80% Bitcoin, 15% Ethereum, 5% cash for dips
RATIONALE: Bitcoin as savings, Ethereum as tech bet, mostly Bitcoin for safety

podcasts.title: On The Brink with Nic Carter
podcasts.key_takeaway: Nic's podcast on crypto, markets, and monetary policy

daily_insights: Your income is directly proportional to the value you provide times the number of people you provide it to.
Skills compound. Every hour you invest in learning pays dividends forever.
The bottleneck to your income is usually a skill you're avoiding learning.
Rich people buy time. Poor people sell time. Which are you doing?
If you can't explain how you'll make money while you sleep, you'll work until you die.
The market pays for value, not effort. Focus on outcomes, not hours.
Your network is your net worth. But only if you provide value first.
The best investment is in skills that produce income. Everything else is secondary.
Don't trade time for money. Trade value for money, then scale the value.
Every rich person got rich by solving problems. What problem are you solving?
Real estate is the one asset class where you can use leverage, get tax benefits, and have someone else pay your mortgage.
Your first rental property doesn't need to be perfect - it needs to teach you the game.
Bitcoin is the first digital asset with provable scarcity. Understanding this changes how you think about money.
House hacking turns your biggest expense (housing) into your first wealth-building asset.
Diversification across asset classes (stocks, real estate, crypto) protects you from any single system failing.
skill_challenges: Identify one skill that would 2x your income. Spend 30 minutes learning it today.
Find one way to add value to someone more successful than you. Do it today.
Calculate your true hourly rate (annual income / hours worked). Now find one way to increase it.
List 3 ways you could make money while you sleep. Pick one to start building.
Reach out to someone who makes 10x what you make. Ask one specific question.
Find something you do manually that could be automated or delegated. Start the process.
Identify your most profitable skill. Spend 1 hour getting better at it.
Write down exactly how you will make your next $1000. Be specific.
Find one expense that doesn't contribute to your growth. Eliminate it.
Study one successful person in your field for 30 minutes. Extract one actionable insight.
Analyze one rental property listing today using the 1% rule (rent should be 1% of purchase price).
Calculate how much you're paying in rent annually. Research if a house hack could reduce this to zero.
Set up a recurring Bitcoin purchase (DCA) of any amount - $10, $50, $100/week. Start building the habit.
Use the 50% rule on a property listing: estimate expenses as 50% of rent, then calculate cash flow.
Research one hardware wallet (Ledger or Trezor) and understand why 'not your keys, not your coins' matters.
